page.title: 19Housing
page.content: The village of Camblesforth is a development area. This is explained by the proximity of both Drax Power Station and the Selby Coal Field. The present population is about 1300 and this is growing. If and when the NCB goes ahead with colliery closures it is expected that several hundred miners will be redeployed to Selby and this will ensure that the village will continue to grow. Village housing is therefore a mixture of old houses and modern development. The Croft Estate is the latest development of private houses. These consist of detached and semi-detached houses and bungalows together with the modern "cottage-style" houses that use a largely open plan interior to maximise very limited space. The Croft Estate can expand still further with space for several hundred more houses.
